title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 January 2012 - XWiki
content:

18:06 <mflorea> has quit  
18:11 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:17 <vmassol> lucaa: can you explain your first screenshot on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/NavigationMenuConfig ?  
18:17 <evalica> has quit  
18:18 <vmassol> ok I think I understand but I don't think you need that here  
18:18 <+lucaa> yeah, maybe not I thought about it too  
18:18 <vmassol> that would be part of the installation instruction but I don't think it's needed  
18:19 <vmassol> btw you should move the install instruction so the instruction field  
18:19 <+lucaa> ok, so that's how it should work  
18:19 <+lucaa> I didn't really understand that fully  
18:19 <+lucaa> lemme fix that  
18:19 <vmassol> k  
18:20 <vmassol> btw I need to check with tmortagne but normally we can add an XObject to add a dep on another extension  
18:20 <vmassol> and the EM will automatically resolve it when you install your app  
18:20 <+lucaa> that would be really brilliant!  
18:20 <vmassol> (I jjust need to check if he's added hte XObject for it)  
18:20 <+lucaa> it's odd because the field says custom installation instructions and the select above says I don't have custom install  
18:20 <vmassol> (the EM already support it)  
18:21 <vmassol> donc click custom install  
18:21 <vmassol> just add your sutff in the textarea  
18:21 <+lucaa> yes, I did  
18:21 <+lucaa> but now I have 2  
18:21 <vmassol> if you select that it's a custom install then you loose the default installations  
18:21 <+lucaa> should I say it needs custom installation?  
18:21 <+lucaa> wdym I loose default installations  
18:21 <+lucaa> ?  
18:21 <vmassol> which you need since your extension is an app  
18:21 <+lucaa> I loose installable with extension manager?  
18:21 <vmassol> which installs like any other app  
18:22 <vmassol> so all you need to is to add extra installation instrcutions  
18:22 <vmassol> if any  
18:22 <+lucaa> yes I did  
18:22 <+lucaa> but look at the page now  
18:23 <+lucaa> the default prereq and installation instructions are above my installation instructions...  
18:23 <vmassol> yes  
18:23 <+lucaa> which is not ok  
18:23 <vmassol> why?  
18:23 <+lucaa> I do have prereqs  
18:23 <vmassol> yeah we don't handle prereqs  
18:23 <+lucaa> I have 2 sections: the default one and then again prerequisites, the ones I added manually  
18:23 <vmassol> just document it differnetly  
18:23 <vmassol> add a warning  
18:24 <vmassol> instead  
18:24 <vmassol> and don't use sections  
18:24 <+lucaa> yeah, I did that initially but then I thought it makes more sense to put that under a section called prereqs  
18:24 <+lucaa> because that's what it is, a prereq  
18:24 <+lucaa> can I leave it as it was before?  
18:24 <vmassol> yes but right now that will not work nicely  
18:24 <vmassol> let me do it  
18:24 <+lucaa> ok...  
18:24 <+lucaa> thanks  
18:25 <+lucaa> btw, it took me a whole lot more to publish this stuff than to code it... :)  
18:25 <+lucaa> we need to fix this  
18:25 <vmassol> sure  
18:25 <vmassol> you're mixing installation and usage  
18:25 <vmassol> I'm fixing it  
18:25 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
18:26 <+lucaa> yeah, I know what you mean  
18:26 <+lucaa> but if you don't setup the panel, it's sort of useless...  
18:26 <+lucaa> although the app is a config app, so configuring a panel is actually usage of a config app...  
18:30 <vmassol> lucaa: when is the second screenshot of the page appearing?  
18:30 <vmassol> just after you install the extension?  
18:30 <+lucaa> yes  
18:31 <vmassol> or after you add the panel?  
18:31 <+lucaa> when the admin stuff is empty  
18:31 <+lucaa> after you add the panel  
18:31 <vmassol> ok  
18:31 <vmassol> moving screenshots  
18:31 <+lucaa> after panel, before configuring the lists  
18:31 <+lucaa> yeah that's what I didn't want  
18:31 <+lucaa> prerequisites at the end of the page///  
18:32 <vmassol> well that's our structure sorry  
18:32 <+lucaa> but it's ok, because i mentioned it's a config tool for that macro so well...  
18:32 <+lucaa> it's ok at the end of the page, but before the actual instructions...  
18:32 <vmassol> ok  
18:32 <+lucaa> s/instructions/install instructions/  
18:32 <vmassol> it's also linked from the TOC  
18:32 <+lucaa> but it should be fine...  
18:34 <+lucaa> thanks!  
18:34 <vmassol> done  
18:35 <Enygma`> has quit

20:37 <vmassol> you'll the memory spikes  
20:37 <vmassol> \*see  
20:37 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
20:38 <@cjdelisle> is there a log where all http requests are stored?  
20:38 <vmassol> seems it restarts fine but gets high memory immediatly  
20:38 <vmassol> yes  
20:38 <vmassol> apache  
20:38 <vmassol> apache request log  
20:38 <@cjdelisle> I imagine what's happening is something's hitting certain pages every now and again.  
20:39 <@cjdelisle> even if not, comparing that to the memory/timeline would give us some good information to work from  
20:39 <vmassol> I do'nt know where the apache logs are though  
20:39 <vmassol> ep  
20:45 <vmassol> let's try to find where apache logs are  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> /var/log/apache/ or /var/log/http ?  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> just guesses  
20:47 <vmassol> yep
